snippet.title: Plainly speaking, we're ripping off Peter Pan
snippet.content: I THINK most people on Earth today would be prepared to form a circle, hold hands and agree that we live in weird times. Times when insurance companies strive to put their policies into plainspeak, yet terms and conditions for home-delivering a pizza require a team of High Court judges to make sense of things. Speaking of plainspeak, I can't recall who I'm quoting, nor if exact, but it went along the lines of: "In my day, we didn't have euphemisms - everybody said what they meant". It was obviously an era that would have had little appeal to today's Spin-Meisters, nor their bosom buddies, the Convoluters. Take the now much-used TV, screen and stage euphemism: re-imagining. "We've re-imagined blah-blah" has far more panache and drips with far more honey than the bald, truthful "we've ripped off blah-blah". And let's face it right here and now, the Spin-Meisters have cleverly re-imagined all the plainspeak words themselves, to the point where nobody has any idea what the heck's being said. Which leads me, heading a one-man revolt, to admit that I'm ripping off J.M. Barrie's wonderful children's tale Peter Pan. Ripping it off with gay abandon in order to prepare a new script for The Indee's summer pantomime, the title of which I'm re-imagining as Peter P and Hook and Smee. Whether this will cause JM to turn in his interment, I don't know, but I re-imagine that he's already turned dozens of times before this. Which further leads me to mention that The Indee at Yandina is seeking potential young actors to train towards the January school holidays production. A rather large cast is needed and the only cost is membership of The Indee Young Players ($10 per financial year, $25 families) and all costumes are supplied. Inquiries to Carol on 5472 8200.
